page.title: 17AN OLD SALT (3)
page.content: The two thousand men on board were too expensive to employ and from 1945 onwards there was a gradual decrease in the number of ships in the British Navy, and those in it were much smaller in size. The Dockyard today is used for ship maintenance, instead of shipbuilding as in 1937. It is also used as a berth for the Royal Navy ships, but there are a lot fewer ships in the Royal Navy, and Portsmouth Dockyard is much less used as it was in the pre-war days. Its most recent occupant was the new flagship of the Royal Navy the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal. Portchester has recently developed as an overflow from Portsmouth of citizens connected to the Royal Navy. Portsmouth now recruits even more Naval personel than ever before.
